content.title: Meghalaya Agriculture Response Vehicle Scheme
content.department: Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya
content.beneficiary: Individual entrepreneurs and registered farmer’s associations
content.details: The scheme aims to provide 50% financial aid to buy commercial vehicles by 200 selected beneficiaries for agriculture transport. These vehicles will help the community involved in agriculture and allied sectors to transport their agricultural products and raw materials. The scheme also focuses on the economic upliftment of farmers by providing them with transportation at a competitive cost.
benefits: 200 agriculture transport vehicles to be distributed across Meghalaya for individual entrepreneurs and any registered farmer’s organizations with 50% financial aid.
Vehicles will be pre-fitted with GPS devices.
Farmers will have access to more vehicles dedicated to agriculture transportation services.
The Project Management Unit will help in the connection between the farmers and agriculture response vehicles when demand arises.
eligibility: Individuals who are permanent residents of Meghalaya and are above 18 years and below 58 years of age.
The applicant must have a valid commercial driving license before buying the vehicle from the dealer.
The applicant must provide valid government ID proof with an address such as Aadhaar Card, Voter ID, and Passport.
The applicant should not be a defaulter at any financial institution.

Any association of farmers involved with agricultural products and legally registered with the government of Meghalaya such as Cooperatives, Farmer Producer Companies (FPC), Farmer Producer Organisation (FPO) are eligible to apply for the scheme.
content.application_process: Offline and Online. Physical forms can be collected from the office of the District Agriculture Offices. Completed forms along with the attached documents must be submitted to the District Agriculture Officer or District Horticulture Officer of the concerned district.
documents_required: A valid government photo identity with an address such as Aadhaar Card, Voter ID, Passport.
A copy of the front page of the savings account passbook, if applicable.
Incorporation Certificate for cooperatives or Registration Certificate for companies.
Bank account statement for the last 6 months, if applicable.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to provide Small Commercial Vehicles and pickups at each CD Block across Meghalaya with 50% financial aid from the Government of Meghalaya.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya.

faqs.question: Who are the beneficiaries under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Any registered farmer’s association and Individual entrepreneurs are the beneficiaries under this scheme.

faqs.question: What is the percentage of financial aid provided to the beneficiary?
How many agriculture transport will be distributed across the state?
Which bank will be the financial agency?
faqs.answer: Financing of the vehicles to the selected beneficiaries of the scheme shall be done through any branch of Meghalaya Rural Bank (MRB).

faqs.question: What will be the repayment tenure?
How to apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The physical forms can be collected from the office of the District Agriculture Offices and after filling it, will need to hand over along with required documents to the District Agriculture Office at the Block office.
